page.title: 11 The Palace of Bromley
page.content: The site of the "Palace of Bromley" has been lived on for over 1000 years. From 955 to 1845 the palace was owned by the Bishops of Rochester. The main Georgian building dates from 1775,it has the Bishops coat-of-arms in stone on the pediment over the front door. The outbuildings of 1775 have been lost; extensions are much more modern. The garden has part of the old ice-house,the remains of the old moat, occupied by "Hissing Sid",the swan,and a well giving "medicinal" waters. From 1935 to 1980 Stockwell College of Education occupied the site and added the library and other buildings. After the closure of the College Bromley Council took over and re-named the complex as the "Civic Centre".Now it houses council officers serving a Borough with a population of 300,000 covering 59 square miles.
